main_definition: To cease activity in order to relax, refresh oneself, or recover strength; a pause from work or strenuous activity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refrain from working or engaging in an activity
meanings_and_examples.example: After running for 30 minutes, he decided to take rest and catch his breath.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To relax and recover strength after exertion
meanings_and_examples.example: The hikers took a short break during their journey to rest and regain energy.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A period of time spent doing nothing or very little
meanings_and_examples.example: I plan to take an hour of rest by reading my favorite book in the afternoon.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To put something aside temporarily for another purpose
meanings_and_examples.example: The painter decided to rest his canvas until he felt inspired again.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A state of calmness and relaxation
meanings_and_examples.example: After a long day, she enjoys meditating as her way of finding inner peace through rest.
